Key Match Events: Draymond Green had 14 points and six assists.
Trayce Jackson-Davis is shooting 22 for 27 (77.7%) over the first five games.
Jordan Hawkins had 23 points for the short-handed Pelicans.
Post-Match Reflections: Golden State's first quarter was strong, making 12 of 23 shots (52.2%) to go ahead 28-20.
Zion Williamson was held to 12 points on 5-for-20 shooting to go with 12 rebounds, a night after he went off for a season-high 31 points.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Buddy Hield scored 21 points, Trayce Jackson-Davis had 15 points and nine rebounds, and the Golden State Warriors beat the New Orleans Pelicans for the second straight night, 104-89 on Wednesday.
Andrew Wiggins also sat out consecutive nights because of low back tightness.
Stephen Curry missed his second straight game with a left ankle injury.
